Articles.Content:
This is my first Kerbal Space Program video. The recording program, MSI Afterburner, didn't record audio for some reason and I didn't bother to do any video editing so this video is uncut. This is technically mission #2 from the previous rescue mission. This is using the "eye-balling orbital rendezvous" technique. I don't know how to do the proper math because I'm too stubborn and lazy to learn it.

Description:

After rescuing the crew of a stranded ship I decided to try an de-orbit the ship. The ship is empty. A Kerbonaut will need to EVA and board it so the parachutes can be activated during Kerbin re-entry.

The ship is on an elliptical orbit and also on a odd incline (~200 degrees).

I'm using the claw from the Damn Robotics mod to lock on to it for de-orbiting.

Video:
